availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Malachi A. Pickering (Caldwell co. KY, constable and farmer )

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, constable and farmer. North Carolina native. Married to Martha H. Pickering. Father of Mary J. Pickering. Constable in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1850. Farmer in Princeton in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Princeton in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 377A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 802.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 35.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 222B.
"Malachi Anderson Pickering (1790-1870," Find A Grave, Memorial #158087688, accessed July 1, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/158087688.
